segments.text: I see a woman standing at the sink, completely absorbed in drying a plate.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The water is overflowing, pouring onto the floor, but she doesn’t even notice.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Her foot is already in the puddle, and yet she keeps polishing that plate like nothing’s wrong.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wonder how long it’s been like this.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The children behind her are up to no good, but she’s totally unaware.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can’t believe she hasn’t turned around yet.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The sink is just gushing water, and the floor is getting more slippery by the second.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Someone is going to fall and get hurt if this keeps up.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I should say something, but I don’t know if she’d even hear me.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: This is such a strange scene—like a disaster happening in slow motion.
segments.speaker: PAR
